page.title: 19ROLE OF THE CHURCHES.
page.content: Of the three churches in this Block, Ockham is the subject of a Special Feature. Wisley is a tiny Norman church and Ripley was rebuilt but keeps its Norman chancel. Pyrford is a very active Parish with two churches just outside the area although only 10% of the population are regular churchgoers clergy remain influential in local affairs. Many non-residents visit and attend Ockham. Most villages in the area are nominally C.of E.; there are also non-conformists and Roman Catholics. Ripley has Methodist and a Baptist chapels. A minority are agnostic or are apathetic, mostly amongst Ockham's newcomers. All church goers are keen to maintain a christian community in the four villages. Most marriages take place in Church; most funerals are cremations.
